metadata.title: CVE-2014-9650 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the management plugin in RabbitMQ 2.1.0through 3.4.x before 3.4.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTPheaders and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the downloadparameter to api/definitions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rabbitmq-server - 3.4.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rabbitmq-server package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.2-2').
